channel.title: MYSQL character saving/loading, not for RSPS
channel.description: Okay so in this game I've made in java, I want to have it load and save characters through an MYSQL database. If someone could teach me/point me in the right direction, it would be greatly appreciated.

item.title: MYSQL character saving/loading, not for RSPS
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“filthjr, post:17, topic:387021”][quote author=n10si t link=topic=482818.msg3535940#msg3535940 date=1300565469]

Sorry, make it query("INSERT INTO `players` (`playerName`,`playerPass`,`Money`) VALUES ('"+Player.playerName+"','"+Player.playerPass+"','"+Player.Money+"');");

Okay, new error. It saves the money correctly, but the playername and playerpass are blank.

Here’s the login code:

System.out.println("Type in your username.");
               
                 try {
                      
                    Player.playerName = br.readLine();
                        if (br.readLine() != null) { 
                           Player.playerName = br.readLine();
                           getPassForLogin();
                        } 
                        
                      } catch (IOException e1) {
                        System.out.println("Error getting the name.");
                   }         
             }

public static void getPassForLogin() {
      
      System.out.println("Enter your password.");
      
      try {
         
         Player.playerPass = br.readLine();
         
         if (br.readLine() != null) {
            Player.playerPass = br.readLine();
            p.yes();
            System.out.println("Game saved.");
         }
         
      } catch (IOException e2) {
         System.out.println("Error getting the password.");
      }
      
   }

[/quote][/quote]
Shit. LOL. That will teach me to not read the topic. I was too busy raging.

EDIT: Wow. I have to agree with filthjr, good luck bro.

Read full topic

item.title: MYSQL character saving/loading, not for RSPS
item.dc:creator: @filthjr filthjr
item.description:
@filthjr wrote:

[quote=“n10si t, post:7, topic:387021”][quote author=sageofmali link=topic=482818.msg3535929#msg3535929 date=1300564680]
Sorry, make it query("INSERT INTO `players` (`playerName`,`playerPass`,`Money`) VALUES ('"+Player.playerName+"','"+Player.playerPass+"','"+Player.Money+"');");
[/quote]

Okay, new error. It saves the money correctly, but the playername and playerpass are blank.

Here’s the login code:

[code=java]
System.out.println(“Type in your username.”);

				  try {
				       
					  Player.playerName = br.readLine();
				         if (br.readLine() != null) { 
				        	 Player.playerName = br.readLine();
				        	 getPassForLogin();
				         } 
				         
				       } catch (IOException e1) {
				         System.out.println("Error getting the name.");
				    }			
			}

public static void getPassForLogin() {

	System.out.println("Enter your password.");
	
	try {
		
		Player.playerPass = br.readLine();
		
		if (br.readLine() != null) {
			Player.playerPass = br.readLine();
			p.yes();
			System.out.println("Game saved.");
		}
		
	} catch (IOException e2) {
		System.out.println("Error getting the password.");
	}
	
}

[/code][/quote]

item.title: MYSQL character saving/loading, not for RSPS
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“n10si t, post:9, topic:387021”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=482818.msg3535947#msg3535947 date=1300565874]
Post your mysql table layout. Are player name and password both varchar/text?
[/quote]

Yes they are, and I’m not sure what you mean by that my table layout.

Is it this?:

   public static boolean savePlayer(Player p) {
      try {
         query("DELETE FROM `players` WHERE playerName = '"+Player.playerName+"';");
         query("INSERT INTO `players` (`playerName`,`playerPass`,`Money`) VALUES ('"+Player.playerName+"','"+Player.playerPass+"','"+Player.Money+"');");
      } catch (Exception e) {
         e.printStackTrace();
         return false;
      }
      return true;
   }

If not, sorry I’m retarded.[/quote]
Why are you passing in a Player parameter if you’re just going to reference every field from a static context, oh, and on that note, stop making every fucking field and method static. [/rage]

EDIT: Also, there’s an UPDATE query in MySQL for a reason.

Read full topic

item.title: MYSQL character saving/loading, not for RSPS
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

Erm, this is what it printed out as in a text document:

===Database players

== Table structure for table players

|------
|Field|Type|Null|Default
|------
|//**playerName**//|varchar(15)|No|
|playerPass|varchar(15)|No|
|Money|double|Yes|NULL
== Dumping data for table players

== Table structure for table players

|------
|Field|Type|Null|Default
|------
|//**playerName**//|varchar(15)|No|
|playerPass|varchar(15)|No|
|Money|double|Yes|NULL

But really all it is is two tables that are varchar(15) and one table thats a double inside the players database

item.title: MYSQL character saving/loading, not for RSPS
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Well first off, you can use MySQL update to save characters that already exist, rather than deleting it then making a new one. Secondly, I think it’s an export function, it prints out how your tables are set up.

Read full topic

item.title: MYSQL character saving/loading, not for RSPS
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

Davidi2:

Post your mysql table layout. Are player name and password both varchar/text?

Yes they are, and I’m not sure what you mean by that my table layout.

Is it this?:

	public static boolean savePlayer(Player p) {
		try {
			query("DELETE FROM `players` WHERE playerName = '"+Player.playerName+"';");
			query("INSERT INTO `players` (`playerName`,`playerPass`,`Money`) VALUES ('"+Player.playerName+"','"+Player.playerPass+"','"+Player.Money+"');");
		} catch (Exception e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
			return false;
		}
		return true;
	}

If not, sorry I’m retarded.

item.title: MYSQL character saving/loading, not for RSPS
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

sageofmali:

Sorry, make it query("INSERT INTO `players` (`playerName`,`playerPass`,`Money`) VALUES ('"+Player.playerName+"','"+Player.playerPass+"','"+Player.Money+"');");

Okay, new error. It saves the money correctly, but the playername and playerpass are blank.

Here’s the login code:

System.out.println("Type in your username.");
					
					  try {
					       
						  Player.playerName = br.readLine();
					         if (br.readLine() != null) { 
					        	 Player.playerName = br.readLine();
					        	 getPassForLogin();
					         } 
					         
					       } catch (IOException e1) {
					         System.out.println("Error getting the name.");
					    }			
    			}

public static void getPassForLogin() {
		
		System.out.println("Enter your password.");
		
		try {
			
			Player.playerPass = br.readLine();
			
			if (br.readLine() != null) {
				Player.playerPass = br.readLine();
				p.yes();
				System.out.println("Game saved.");
			}
			
		} catch (IOException e2) {
			System.out.println("Error getting the password.");
		}
		
	}

[/quote]Add this at the end "); so it looks like query("INSERT INTO `players` (`playerName`,`playerPass`,`Money`) VALUES ('"+Player.playerName+"','"+Player.playerPass+"','"+Player.Money+"'");");[/quote]

I get an error upon compiling, unclosed string literal.
